page.title: 01The Roehampton Area
page.content: Our Area is administered by 4 Local Authorities: London Boroughs of Merton, Wandsworth, Richmond and Kingston Surrey. Over half the Area is parkland or common. Wimbledon Common, a wooded heathland carefully conserved for urban recreational purposes, contains a wind- mill, ponds, golf courses and sports pitches. Richmond Park is a Royal Park, mainly grassland with scattered trees, a few wooded plantations, ponds, sports pitches and some houses, notably White Lodge home of the Royal Ballet School. The areas of desirable,expensive, detached houses contrast sharply with the Council Estates in the area. There are not many shops locally. Some large Georgian houses are now colleges. Noisy traffic bisects the area on the A3 road and increasingly on the A306. This latter road is ruining Roehampton Village and divides the community.
